slash_commands.name: Slash Commands
slash_commands.content:
# Slash Commands Example

You can use Discord Player with slash commands. **[Here](https://github.com/Androz2091/discord-player/blob/master/example/music-bot)** is an example on how to use this framework with slash commands.

how_does_it_work.name: How Does It Work
how_does_it_work.content:
# How does Discord Player actually work?

- Discord Player can be used by first initializing `Player` class with your discord.js client. Discord Player uses `Queue` to assign queue manager to individual guild.
Which means each guild will have its own queue object. Every player action has to go through the `Queue` object for example, `play`, `pause`, `volume` etc.

- When `Player` is initialized, it creates a cache to store external extractors or queues information. Queue is created by calling `createQueue` method of `Player` instance.
A client should have only one `Player` instance, otherwise it will be complicated to track queues and other metadata.

- Searching tracks can be done via `search` method of `Player` instance. Discord Player offers `search engine` option to target specific searches. Discord Player first
calls all the registered extractors first with the search query. If all external extractors failed to validate the query, player then passes the query to built-in extractors.
Invalid or unknown queries may return `arbitrary` result.

- The track result obtained from `search` can be loaded into `Queue` by calling `queue.addTrack`/`queue.addTracks`/`queue.play`.

- Player calls `onBeforeCreateStream` if user has enabled the function while creating queue. This method runs each time before stream is downloaded. Users may use it
to modify how and which stream will be played.

- Queue is based on FIFO method (First In First Out)

- Final stream is a pcm format, required for volume controls which is created by Discord Player itself.

- Since inline volume is enabled by default for volume controls, you may face more resource usage.

- You can disable inline volume for better performance but setting volume won't work and current volume will always be 100.

- All the audio filters are handled by FFmpeg and stream has to reload in order to update filters.

cookies.name: Using Cookies

proxy.name: Using Proxy

methods.name: createQueue
methods.description: Creates a queue for a guild if not available, else returns existing queue

methods.name: deleteQueue
methods.description: Deletes a queue and returns deleted queue object

params.name: force
params.description: Overwrite existing extractor with this name (if available)

methods.name: scanDeps
methods.description: Generates a report of the dependencies used by the @discordjs/voice module. Useful for debugging.

events.name: botDisconnect
events.description: Emitted when bot gets disconnected from a voice channel

events.name: channelEmpty
events.description: Emitted when the voice channel is empty

events.name: connectionCreate
events.description: Emitted when bot connects to a voice channel

events.name: error
events.description: Emitted on error This event should handled properly otherwise it may crash your process!

events.name: connectionError
events.description: Emitted on connection error. Sometimes stream errors are emitted here as well.

events.name: trackAdd
events.description: Emitted when a single track is added

methods.name: validate
methods.description: Method used by Discord Player to validate query with this extractor

params.name: withTracks
params.description: If it should build json with tracks

methods.name: getTrackPosition
methods.description: Returns the index of the specified track. If found, returns the track index else returns -1.

methods.name: skipTo
methods.description: Jumps to particular track, removing other tracks on the way

methods.name: insert
methods.description: Inserts the given track to specified index

params.name: index
params.description: The index where this track should be

params.name: src
params.description: The track to play (if empty, uses first track from the queue)

params.name: track
params.description: The source track to find its similar track for autoplay

props.name: queue
props.description: The queue in which this track is located

params.name: interpolateSilence
params.description: If true, the player will play 5 packets of silence after pausing to prevent audio glitches.

props.name: cache
props.description: The cache where voice utils stores stream managers

methods.name: connect
methods.description: Joins a voice channel, creating basic stream dispatch manager

methods.name: last
methods.description: Picks last item of the given array

methods.name: isVoiceEmpty
methods.description: Checks if the voice channel is empty

props.name: queue
props.description: If it should create progress bar for the whole queue

props.name: autoSelfDeaf
props.description: If it should set the bot in deaf mode

props.name: spotifyBridge
props.description: If player should bridge spotify source to youtube

props.name: volumeSmoothness
props.description: The volume transition smoothness between volume changes (lower the value to get better result) Setting this or leaving this empty will disable this effect. Example: volumeSmoothness: 0.1

typedefs.name: QueryType
typedefs.description:
The search query type This can be one of:

  • AUTO
  • YOUTUBE
  • YOUTUBE_PLAYLIST
  • SOUNDCLOUD_TRACK
  • SOUNDCLOUD_PLAYLIST
  • SOUNDCLOUD
  • SPOTIFY_SONG
  • SPOTIFY_ALBUM
  • SPOTIFY_PLAYLIST
  • FACEBOOK
  • VIMEO
  • ARBITRARY
  • REVERBNATION
  • YOUTUBE_SEARCH
  • YOUTUBE_VIDEO
  • SOUNDCLOUD_SEARCH

typedefs.name: QueueRepeatMode
typedefs.description:
The queue repeat mode. This can be one of:

  • OFF
  • TRACK
  • QUEUE
  • AUTOPLAY
